caption: Quantitative comparison with existing video interpolation methods on reconstruction and generative metrics, evaluated on all 7 generated frames.
description: The table presents a quantitative comparison of Framer with several existing video interpolation methods.  It evaluates performance on two datasets, DAVIS-7 and UCF101-7, across seven generated frames using a range of metrics: PSNR (Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio), SSIM (Structural Similarity Index), LPIPS (Learned Perceptual Image Patch Similarity), FID (Fréchet Inception Distance), and FVD (Fréchet Video Distance).  The metrics assess both reconstruction quality (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS) and perceptual similarity (FID, FVD) of generated frames compared to ground truth.  Results are shown for Framer both with and without Co-Tracker (a point-tracking method) highlighting the performance improvement with the addition of this functionality.  Comparisons are made to methods categorized as both traditional (e.g., AMT, RIFE, FLAVR, FILM) and generative (e.g., LDMVFI, DynamicCrafter, SVDKFI) video interpolation approaches.

caption: Quantitative comparison with existing video interpolation methods on reconstruction and generative metrics, evaluated on all 7 generated frames.
description: The table presents a quantitative comparison of Framer with several existing video interpolation methods across various metrics, including PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS, FID, and FVD.  The comparison is conducted on two datasets, DAVIS-7 and UCF101-7, evaluating the performance on all 7 generated frames.  The metrics assess both reconstruction quality (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS) and generative quality (FID, FVD). Framer is compared against both traditional flow-based and kernel-based methods, and also against more recent generative methods.  The results show that Framer outperforms the other methods across many of the metrics. A separate row is dedicated to Framer's performance when using the Co-Tracker for point trajectory estimation, further demonstrating performance improvements.

caption: Table 1: Quantitative comparison with existing video interpolation methods on reconstruction and generative metrics, evaluated on all 7 generated frames.
description: Table 1 presents a quantitative comparison of Framer with other video interpolation methods.  The comparison is based on reconstruction and generative metrics (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS, FID, FVD) for seven generated frames.  The results are presented for two datasets, DAVIS-7 and UCF101-7.  For each dataset, the table shows the performance of Framer compared to AMT, RIFE, FLAVR, FILM, LDMVFI, DynamicCrafter, and SVDKFI.  The performance is also shown for Framer when using Co-Tracker, highlighting the benefit of trajectory refinement.

caption: Table 1: Quantitative comparison with existing video interpolation methods on reconstruction and generative metrics, evaluated on all 7 generated frames.
description: Table 1 presents a quantitative comparison of Framer against several existing video interpolation methods.  The comparison is based on reconstruction and generative metrics, evaluated across seven generated frames for two datasets, DAVIS-7 and UCF101-7.  For each method and dataset, the table lists the Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio (PSNR), Structural Similarity Index (SSIM), Learned Perceptual Image Patch Similarity (LPIPS), Fréchet Inception Distance (FID), and Video Fréchet Inception Distance (FVD) scores. Higher PSNR and SSIM values indicate better reconstruction quality, while lower LPIPS, FID, and FVD values suggest better perceptual quality and fidelity.  The results show that Framer outperforms the other methods across most of the metrics, demonstrating its superior performance in video frame interpolation.

caption: Quantitative comparison with existing video interpolation methods on reconstruction and generative metrics, evaluated on all 7 generated frames.
description: Table 1 presents a quantitative comparison of Framer against several existing video interpolation methods.  The evaluation is performed on two datasets, DAVIS-7 and UCF101-7, and considers both reconstruction metrics (PSNR, SSIM, LPIPS) and generative metrics (FID, FVD).  The results are shown for all seven generated frames in each case.  Framer is compared against both traditional methods (AMT, RIFE, FLAVR, FILM) and other recent diffusion-based methods (LDMVFI, DynamicCrafter, SVDKFI).  The table also provides a comparison for Framer using the Co-Tracker approach, showing its performance gains.
